Players take turns rolling the dice and moving around the board in hopes of staking claims in one of the five mines available. Once a player obtains a share in a mine he may dig in it, once he lands or passes the ‘mine for gold’ space. When a player mines for gold he draws one of the ‘golden nugget’ cards and records the amount of gold found, on a score sheet.

During the game, the price of gold will fluctuate when players land on the ‘gold rises’ or ‘gold drops’ spaces, causing his gold to be worth more or less throughout the game. He must try to get this gold to the bank while the price of gold is still high, in order to receive cash payment for his gold. He may of course, deposit as much or as little of his gold as he wishes, hoping for higher prices later.

He must be careful though. There are outlaws waiting to steal all un deposited gold from you. Throughout the game, players can jump claims of other players, thus stealing away their shares of mines, preventing them from gaining more gold. The player who manages to get one million cash on hand first will win the game.

110346.description:
'From the back of the book'

Battles in the Underhive is a compilation of some of the most sought-after Necromunda articles from the pages of White Dwarf magazine and the Citadel Journal. This book also contains new Event cards and rules for using them, an article about playing the feared Adeptus Arbites, and Triple Cross: a brand new scenario by Andy Chambers. Also included is a comprehensive catalogue section, listing all Necromunda models.
110346.name: Necromunda: Battles in the Underhive

110347.name: Mission X
110347.description:
From the Intellivision manual

OBJECT OF THE GAME
You control a World War II attacker bomber in a special, death-defying mission...where EVERYTHING you destroy counts. Your targets are combat ships, aircraft carriers, tanks, trucks, trains and the like, and you must fight DAY and NIGHT to succeed! You can fly your plane up, down, left, right, or at an angle, and both drop BOMBS and shoot BULLETS. WATCH OUT for the ENEMY! They always fire at you from the ground and chase you in the air!

Runways appear at the beginning and between battle cycles. Your score appears between battle cycles and when you are hit. There are 4 skill levels and 12 types of targets. Both single and multiple hits are possible. Scoring gets tougher by the minute! This is prime-time WAR ACTION! If you fail the first time, you are given 3 more chances! So BLOW them to PIECES, score HIGH and get your mission RIGHT!

110348.name: Harem: An Exotic Card Game
110348.description: Harem is an easy-to-learn card game where you attempt to create the most envied harem in the lands. Players take the role of a Sultan and play gold and gems to eventually buy harem concubines. But watch out for opponents who hire thieves to threaten your treasury. Once in the harem, concubines train in the arts of dancing and seduction and adorn themselves with jewels. The player with the best harem in the end is the winner!

110349.name: Camp Death
110349.description:
Publisher Blurb:

So, here's the deal. Camp Clearwater's been abandoned since some grisly, "unsolved" murders 20 years ago. Or whatever. The new owner probably made that up as some creepy story to tell the campers and scare up business.

What I know is that we've got a couple weeks to get this place set up before any campers arrive, and most of the hard work is already done. We've got enough booze, pot, and distance from authority to make this the greatest summer ever.

What could go wrong?

110350.name: Intellivision
110350.description:
The Intellivision is a video game console released by Mattel in 1979. Development of the console began in 1978, less than a year after the introduction of its main competitor, the Atari 2600. The word intellivision is a portmanteau of "intelligent television". Over 3 million Intellivision units were sold and a total of 125 games were released for the console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Intellivision", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

110351.name: Das große KiKa-Quiz
110351.description:
The players try to pull her figures on the quiz fields and answer a questions there or solve a problem.
Player gets reward chip after correct answer or solved problem
Who first has one chip in each color wins. The tasks are drawing and pantomime, the other pictograms are available for questions on the areas hobby, nature, culture, technology, or conundrums. The player can decide whether to draw task or take pantomime.

110352.name: Das grosse KiKa-Quiz für die Vorschule
110352.description:
Preschool verison.
This quiz is playable without being able to read, the tasks come from the daily life of children, each card shows the task and three possible solutions. In a turn a player rolls the die, moves and solves the question of a corresponding card. Tasks are: watch closely, listen acutely, recognize and allocate questions, count and compare or which pictures form a new word? The solution chosen is marked by holding the card with two fingers over the solution, if the finger at the back points at the "Schlaumeir", the answer is correct. For a correct answer player receives the card, the player who first has five cards wins the game.

110353.name: Die Schatzsucher
110353.description:
Chili, Briegel and Bernd paddle from island to island looking for treasure. Whoever discovers the right paddle cards can push the raft to the desired island, and take away the plate there, under where he suspects the treasure chest is. Whoever knocks a piece over the raft can not find a treasure. Anyone who discovers a treasure chest can uncover all the tiles of the island, they are all coins, he gets them all. Anyone who discovers a bomb, loses all coins on the island of the pirates, if there is a sand nothing happens.
If all plates cleared away, the player with the most gold wins.

110354.name: Pocket Quiz: Filmzitate
110354.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Movie Quotes" and the questions are about that topic.

110355.name: Through the Looking Glass
110355.description:
User Summary

One of the first games created and released by Apple, Through the Looking Glass is a game of chess in which you control Alice from Charles Lutwidge Dodgson's famous novel. Each round, you take control of the piece you want and apply any of its possible legal moves. Your objective is to capture enough enemy pieces to lead to the enemy's defeat. Your score fluctuates throughout the game and is based on the value of enemy pieces taken versus the value of your own pieces lost.

110356.description:
New Imperialism in China is a 3-7 player strategic-level board wargame, simulates the foreign enclaves in China 1900 - 1911.

Each turn represents one year.
Players play the role of "Great Qing Empire", "Great Japanese Empire", "United States", "British Empire", "French Republic", "Dutch Empire", "Russian Empire", respectively.
Players control area with supply point to produce army and fleet for further expansion in each turn. Player who controls the most areas on 12th turn wins.
110356.name: New Imperialism in China

110357.name: Journal of American Paranormal Research (Vol 1, Issue 1 - Spring 2003)
110357.description:
Contents:

1, Nazi Identified in Rosetta
2, Truck-Sized Catfish Reported

User note: The 'zine is written in to be used as a game prop and intended as in-game "fact."

110358.name: Nobunaga Gunki
110358.description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #11.

A strategic level wargame about unification of Owari Province based on early years of Oda Nobunaga (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oda_Nobunaga).
NB: A "gunki" is a war story (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari).

Players control either Oda clan or Imagawa clan, and challenge to unification of Owari province.
Players can perform multiple actions in single turn based on the funds held.
The winner is determined by victory points from control of castle.

110359.name: Addiktion (Issue 1 - Jul 2011)
110359.description:
from the introduction:

Welcome to the first issue of Addiktion, the monthly newsletter devoted to GameAddikts products. This month we have a sneak preview of the Psypher 2430 Core Rulebook and a short article on the history of our game. Security Report: Bastik gives background information on Bastik, Purgatory’s largest settlement. Finally, the Purgatory QuickStart Appendix allows players and Gamemaster to keep the fun going on Purgatory with character advancement rules, gear options, and two new missions

110360.name: The Guild Companion (May 2004)
110360.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110361.name: The Guild Companion (Jun 2004)
110361.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110362.name: The Guild Companion (Jul 2004)
110362.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110363.name: The Gunstringer

videogamehonor.31261: 2011 Spike Best Motion Game of the Year Nominee

110363.description:
Buried and left for dead by his former posse, a skeleton cowboy marionette begins his journey of revenge, aided only by his gritty resolve and trusty pistol. He will track his betrayers down, one by one, and bring justice upon them. They will pay a mean price on their own turf, from the plains of the high desert, to the swamps of the bayou, to the east Asian mountains, down to the depths of the undead underworld. Nothing can stand in his way, nothing will stop him on the vengeance trail

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary

The Gunstringer is a Kinect title, using player's body to control the main character a marionette on strings - movement, aim and fire are the main actions

110364.name: The Guild Companion (Aug 2004)
110364.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110365.name: The Guild Companion (Sep 2004)
110365.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110366.name: The Guild Companion (Oct 2004)
110366.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110367.name: The Guild Companion (Nov 2004)
110367.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110368.name: The Guild Companion (Dec 2004)
110368.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110369.name: The Guild Companion (Jan 2005)

rpgissuearticle.66939: Announcement: MECCG tournament in the UK

110369.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110370.name: Addiktion (Special Edition 1 - Jun 2011)
110370.description:
from the introduction:

Addiktion is the monthly newsletter devoted to GameAddikts products and news. This special edition of Addiktion is presented to make a few introductions, present our first releases in the Psypher 2430 line, and showcase a few of our upcoming products. We will begin our normal monthly schedule with Issue No.1 coming out next month.

110371.name: Addiktion (Issue 2 - Aug 2011)
110371.description:
from the introduction:

This month we have quite a lot going on. We have a sneak preview of the upcoming Planetary Guide to Purgatory for Psypher 2430. Our second Security Report takes us to Grantin Station, a hub of intergalactic travel and intrigue, and our newest column, Tech News 2430, provides a list of new equipment options for characters.

110372.name: Addiktion (Special Edition 2 - Sep 2011)
110372.description:
from the introduction:

This Special Edition of Addiktion has one very exciting purpose: to introduce our next product line. We’ve been building up to this for nearly a month now, so let’s get right to it. GameAddikts and Addiktion are proud to present: Psypher Shadows.

110373.name: Addiktion (Issue 3 - Oct 2011)
110373.description:
from the introduction:

In this issue of Addiktion we will be showcasing the first supplement for the Psypher Shadows line, Artifacts of the First Cataclysm. It introduces magical items to the world of Psypher Shadows and details how to construct them, as well as highlighting twenty of the most powerful artifacts crafted during the First Cataclysm.

110374.name: Well You Bowled!
110374.description:
A board game of Flat Green Bowls

Well You Bowled is a board game based on the sport of flat green bowls. The object of the game, as in real bowls, is to get as many of your woods as possible nearre the Jack than your opponent's nearest wood. The game is designed to be played by two teams of up to four players, but may be played in on an individual basis if required. The game is played over a series of "ends".

Each end the jack is set, then each player places a wood along the baseline and declares the intended length, then draws a card from the top of the deck to determine the position of that wood on the rink in relation to the position nominated. If the wood hits another, then the "wick" cards give directions for the two playing pieces. Players may instead of drawing a card to elect to fire. Instead they draw from the fire deck and follow the instructions. Once all players have played their woods, then end is finished, and the end is scored, and another one started. A game is either played to an agreed number of ends or an agreed number of shots (points).

110376.name: Journal of American Paranormal Research (Vol 1, Issue 2 - Summer 2003)
110376.description:
Contents:

1, Native American Spirits Angered at La Bonita Espiritu Flores
6, La Bonita Character Info
7, Chupacabra

110377.name: Journal of American Paranormal Research (Vol 1, Issue 3 - Spring 2004)
110377.description:
Contents:

1, The Message by Neal Hyde: A Modern d20 System Horror Adventure for 12 to Midnight’s Pinebox Setting
8, Appendix
9, Maps

110378.name: Journal of American Paranormal Research (Vol 1, Issue 4 - Summer 2004)
110378.description:
Contents:

1, The Cradle, part 1 by Ed Wetterman

3, Sumerian Gods & Goddesses
4, Plot Threads
6, Enkidu Beast Men
6, Gilgamesh
7, Huwawa
8, Bull of Heaven




1, Midnight Deadlines by Ed Wetterman
9, Pinebox Campaign Setting by Craig Largent

10, Pinebox Places
10, Pinebox Plot Threads
10, Crenshaw’s Devil
11, Paranormal Lexicon

110379.name: NASCAR Grand National Series Expansion Pack
110379.description:
PAPYRUS' NASCAR GRAND NATIONAL SERIES EXPANSION PACK
SHIPS TO STORES

Watertown, MA, November 3, 1997 -- Papyrus Design Group, a division of Sierra On-Line, Inc., announces its NASCAR Grand National Series Expansion Pack has shipped to stores. The Expansion pack includes ten new tracks, two fantasy tracks and 30 new drivers each with their familiar team and car.

The NASCAR Grand National Series Expansion Pack enhances the experience of NASCAR Racing 2, the #6-selling game in the nation (according to PC Data). NASCAR Racing 2 features 1996 drivers, cars and sponsors, and allows competition in a full championship season on sixteen NASCAR sanctioned tracks. The game's physics model renders a high degree of realism, duplicating actual car behavior and responding to track and weather conditions. Competitors also enjoy realistic detail in the car setups and are able to race head-to-head via modem or over the Internet.

"NASCAR is always working to better serve the fans, drivers, teams, and tracks," said George Pyne, NASCAR vice president of licensing and consumer products. "The new NASCAR Grand National Series Expansion Pack provides fans with the opportunity to experience the thrill of competition in the popular NASCAR Busch series."

"We paid even more attention to the detail, the light and features of these tracks," Matt Marsala, producer of the Expansion Pack, said, "the result is a completely new, accurate racing experience in conjunction with NASCAR Racing 2."

The Packs' newly constructed tracks are:
Texas Motor Speedway
California Speedway
Gateway International Raceway

Other new tracks with a NASCAR tradition include:
South Boston Speedway
Nashville Speedway USA
Hickory Motor Speedway
Indianapolis Raceway Park
Myrtle Beach Speedway
Nazareth Speedway
The Milwaukee Mile

The "Fantasy Tracks" included in the program are:
Bull Run Raceway
Red Rock Raceway

Among the Expansion Pack's 30 new drivers are:
Raybestos Rookie-of-the-Year points leader Steve Park and his #3 AC Delco Chevrolet. Steve is currently ranked 3rd in points.
1996 and 1997 champion Randy LaJoie and his #74 FINA Chevrolet
Todd Bodine and his #36 Stanley Pontiac, second place in series points. Headed for the NASCAR Winston Cup Series in 1998, Bodine is younger brother to NASCAR Winston Cup veterans Geoff and Brett Bodine.

NASCAR Racing 2 for MS-DOS is available at computer stores everywhere or by calling Sierra direct at (800) 757-7707. Estimated retail price is $49.95. Other NASCAR. racing products in the Papyrus family are NASCAR. Racing, NASCAR. Racing for Mac and NASCAR. Racing for the Playstation.

Source: Press Release.

110380.name: Lion
110380.description:
Back of Game Box

A Wildlife Simulation

Hungry for lunch, you scan your radar view and detect a nearby herd of giraffes. Your endurance and strength ratings are low, so you'll have only one shot. You gather your pride downwind and strategically plan the attack. Kabaka drives the giraffes toward you, Umar comes in from the left and you both go in for the kill. Life is good when you're the King of Beasts...or is it? Food and water become scarce, poachers hunt you down and predators attack your pride. Do you have what it takes to survive in this incredibly realistic wildlife simulation?

Play 20 different lions, each with distinct capabilities, talents and kill-success ratings.

Complete 20 mission-based scenarios containing exciting and deadly challenges.

Play as single nomad or control multiple lions in a pride.

Become the hunter or the hunted, Radar-style maps locate eleven varieties of prey and two types of predators.

Create your own free-form simulation choosing from 5 difficulty levels.

Take a Safari into the wilds of Africa designed to enhance your game. The more you develop a lion's instincts, the higher your score.

Fast, fluid 3-D graphics and dynamic sounds create the ultimate simulation.

Experience the ferocious power of Lion today. Where else can you be rewarded for your animal behavior.

The Predator series
Games you really sink your teeth into.

Requirements: IBM PC and 100% compatibles, 486DX/33 (486DX/66 recommended), MS-DOS 5.0, 4MB RAM (if launched in DOS) 8MB RAM (if launched in Windows 3.1 or later), hard drive with 20MB free space, 2x CD-ROM drive, VESA compatible Super VGA video card, Sound Blaster or compatible sound card, mouse, external speakers recommended.

110381.name: Wolf
110381.description:
Game Box

Your heart is racing.
Th-thump. Th-thump.
It's pumping as fast as your legs.
You don't notice the gentle breeze, the noon-day sky. You are really focused.
On the smell.
Just the smell.
Could be the first think you can sink your teeth into, in days.
Dust, pebbles, sticks.
They're flying.
Then you pounce.
Suddenly. Stealthily.
You break its neck.
You're a wolf.
Really. In this wilderness survival adventure, that's exactly what you are.
Which means you experience all the sights, sounds ... and smells ... of a timber wolf firsthand.
That's what makes this game unlike any other.
It's chillingly real.
So real that it just might blow you away.
(Or maybe a predator will.)
Will you survive 40 different scenarios and open-ended play?
Your instincts - and the interactive wolf museum where survival tips are just a point-and-click away - will decide.
As you hunt.
Fight.
Mate.
You animal, you.

110382.name: Hodj 'n' Podj
110382.description:
Game Box

HODJ 'N' PODJ is a rambunctious collection of your favorite games with all new twists and none of the old drawbacks... like missing pieces and annoying opponents.

As Prince Hodj or Podj, you'll play 19 wacky mini-games in a fantasty land called Po-Porree. Here you must rescue Princesses Mish and Mosh from that creepy Prime Minister Salmigundee. Or not.

Have a ball playing games you know and love like Battlefish, Maze o' Doom, Barbershop Quintet or Poker all on their own. Or, if you're feeling generous, play them as a way to save the Princessess in a sly fairy tale adventure where winning is only half the fun.

Played alone or with family and friends, HODJ 'N' PODJ lets you spend less time rummaging through drawers looking for those dingy dice and more time just having fun.

Features

Two hours of digital audio means you'll enjoy witty running commentary and unsolicited heckling from the Peanut Gallery.

A gleefully animated, cleverly-told introductory fairy tale starts you on your adventure.

Play with family and friends or an especially mischievous computer opponent.

Customize your games to be long or short, easy or hard.

19 arcade, card, word, casino, and classic board games that can be played individually or as part of a bigger game.

From Steve Meretzky, the award-winning creator of Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy and Planetfall computer software.

110383.name: Scramblitz
110383.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scramblitz requires fast thinking and faster fingers. Each player starts with a mat and a set of 16 double-sided tiles. Your objective: be the first player to arrange your tiles to match the puzzle card. The challenge: which sides of your tiles should face up? It takes plenty of flipping, flopping and swapping to win the game.

110384.name: Look Look
110384.description: Crazy creatures abound in this fast-paced, mixed-up matching race! Draw a card to reveal the challenge. Will you need to find the identical creatures within two differently colored frames, or do quick math once you spot the numbers? Race against your opponents to spot it or solve it. The winner keeps the card. Be the first to collect enough cards to spell “Look Look,” and you take the game! Game board is comprised of eight interchangeable frames, making it a new game every time you play. Includes 68 challenge cards. 2 or more players.

110385.name: Visavis
110385.description:
An abstract strategy game played on a special board. Two players, X and O, take turns placing a bridge between any two of their adjacent pegs not blocked by an existing bridge. The first player to complete a connected chain of bridges between their sides wins. Ties are not possible.

Visavis is a Shannon switching game on the edges and belongs to the same class of connection games as Bridg-It and TwixT (and to some extend Trellis). Even though a trivial winning strategy has been found for Bridg-It (called Connexxions on the server) Visavis consists of a more complex system of overlaid triangular grids that allows richer variety of play, and no winning strategy is known.

Michail Antonow points out that different tactics must be applied when blocking an opponent's rightward path as opposed to a leftward path. The path can be abruptly cut by a single piece in one direction only; in the opposite direction a single bridge will only divert the path and two bridges are needed for a successful block.

The rules state that a bridge can be placed between any two adjacent pegs of the same colour. However since it can never help to place a bridge between the opponent's pegs, then it is assumed that all moves are made between the current player's pegs. This also simplifies the board notation.

110386.name: Knights & Glory
110386.description:
Nobles from across the land have been called to compete in grand tournaments as the King is looking for a new champion of the realm. This champion will be determined by the Noble who gains the most glory in these grand tournaments.

Knights from across the realm gather to serve these nobles and gain the rewards of riches and glory in their service.

Can you take on the role of one of these Nobles and use the knights that decide to serve you in order to gain the glory needed to be champion of the realm?

The challenge is to collect Knights from the 6 different Event Types included in the game to create a team that will compete against the other Nobles team of knights for glory in the different tournament seasons. Knights cost money and the Nobles only collect a certain amount each tournament season to pay for their knights. The Tournaments are played by Nobles secretly deciding in which order their knights will compete and then by simply turning their cards face down in their hand to create a small deck they begin drawing their cards one at a time off the top of these decks to play against another Noble's knights in individual competition. Points are scored for the Noble with the highest value knight played (six cards will be played against one another in this way) - and 1 glory is gained by the Noble with the most points at the end of that competition.

A Tournament is made up of each Noble in the game plying each other once in a competition like the one described above.

Once the tournament season is over players have to return some knights to their season decks / hire other knights / collect gold / and try to gain more glory in the next Tournament.

The Game ends when one Noble gains enough glory to win the Kings favor, and become champion of the realm.

110387.name: Skreek
110387.description:
From Introduction:

Completely loyal to the Raiders Guild, these masterful scouts make their home within Guild strong holds, mimicking their lost caves within.
Beware any who cross a skreek for hiding from them is near impossible.
Play a skreet if you want...

to be silent and eerie.
to daze your foes so that others may move in to attack.
to be able to climb easily and hang upside down.
to be a member of a race that favours the rogue and ranger classes.




Physical Qualities
The skreek are short, hunched, bat-like humanoids. Their exaggerated frames sport broad upper torsos, narrow hips, and oversized feet. Their fur ranges in color from light gray to chestnut brown to nightblack. The clawed hands of a skreek are surprisingly dexterous. They move with a quiet, creepy grace and, when not in motion, achieve a preternatural stillness. Skreek ancestors lost their wings long before the race achieved sentience; a vestigial remnant appears in the form of a pronounced underarm membrane.

110388.name: Raiders Guild Players Guide
110388.description:
From publisher blurb:

Congratulations, adventurer! After months of toil and trial, you, and the other members of your adventuring band, have been chosen to join the Raiders Guild. You have every right to be proud of this great honor. The strength, bravery, and magical prowess the competitors you overcame for this coveted spot were considerable. Your sparring partners, all honored members of the guild fought ferociously. Certain of the strikes you sustained still echo in your bones. Yet here you are, about to step onto a rude wooden platform erected in the middle of the guild compound. Assembled about you is a motley band of heroes and explorers, among whose company you are proud to stand. Garvius himself will lead you in the raider's oath and then present you with your guild medallion.

Raiders Guild Player Guide shows off the guild that brings parties together and gives them a real reason to descend into the deepest dungeons. Designed for use with 4th edition Dungeons & Dragons, the guide not only gives you background material about the guild and their arch foes the intensely secretive Archivist but a new playable race, the Skreek bat-folk.

110389.name: Wyrmslayer
110389.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wyrmslayer: A Sword for One Purpose

A short adventure produced for the 4th ed. game system! This is made for levels 5-8 with a variety of classes. It also includes full page, color maps and a second downpload that contains the stats for all of the NPCs and monsters. This is an excellent follow up to Beyond the Black Door, as Wyrmslayer begins where the previous left off.

A mysterious stranger who claims to be a dragon rider is in Deepport looking for a company of heroes to retreive artifacts that will help him take his role in an ages old prophecy. Aragorn Cloud communicates directly with dragons by telepathy. He knows that the remaining dragons who live in the mountain on the Isle of Io are in an uproar and are a danger to man and themselves. No dragons are evil in this world. Until recently, a dragon had never attacked innocents!

Your PCs will travel the Inland Sea, battle pirates, storms and other terrors before they reach the Isle of Io. Once there, they have the task of exploring Dragon Mountain and looking for clues to find the artifacts. Many of the lairs are empty and other things have moved into the ancient stronghold. The treasure and rewards are high but then, so is the danger!

110390.name: 3.5 NPCs & Monsters
110390.description:
From publisher blurb:

NPCs and Monsters from the demi-plane of Hanan Pacha!

There are 14 solo NPCs to go along with everything else, including many illustrations. Here is a full compliment of orc shock troops and ogre mage team for the next battle in your fantasy setting. We have centurions, leaders, shaman and an ogre mage squad to use in battles. You will also find succubi, (new) Horus the horiad demon, (new) a shadowsaur, Zornacor the dwarf vampire, the werewolf called James Morris and his dire wolves, the fighter Taluri Rana, Miles O'Keefe, the shapechanging druid, Skella the night hag, Wokrah the undead ettin, William Claban the wizard and Gaaellon the gold dragon in this manual of unique monsters.

110391.name: 3.5 NPCs & Monsters II
110391.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this supplement are some of the unique creatures that we have placed in our world. We have a fearsome ape that inhabits the tropical jungles and a yeti-sized ape that inhabits the snowy mountains. Get acquainted with a new player-NPC race called the Zanir. Meet the Chupacabra, the mysterious creature that has strange dining habits. Face the dreaded cavern devourer, a ghost named Julio and a new creation...the nightwalker. Turn another page and you will see the scuttling crab-like creature called the Monster Bug, complete with a humanoid head! Four completely new races and monsters from our adventures.

110392.name: 3.5 NPCs & Monsters III
110392.description:
From publisher blurb:

We have a variety of NPCs in this supplement. A subtitle could be: Adversary, Army, Allies & Annoyances.

You will find a Very Bad Adversary (Varnakula the black vrock demon lord), a platoon of soldiers, officers (4) and a general (Lord Oxney) from the Republic of Mantheron, some powerful NPC allies (half-elf ranger Ariana Brightstar & Bull Kraken, a minotaur) and a pair of halfling (Fric & Frac) annoyances!

110393.name: Beyond the Black Door
110393.description:
From publisher blurb:

The routine exploration of a cleared dungeon turns into a nightmare when a gate operates suddenly and without warning. The PCs are gated into the lower plane called Acheron: a shadowy, cold and dismal land where evil is in control and there is only one way out. The adventurers arrive near a town called, Necros Mustafa, where the action is fast and many of the inhabitants dead...or undead. In this adventure, a vampire turns out to be a valuable guide and not a feared opponent! The town even has a regular ferry service, which crosses the river Styx. Your players will be delighted to meet Charon, the boatman on the river Styx!

Travel within Acheron is dangerous and deadly, especially for those who are foreign to this plane! The PCs need to find out how to get past the guardian (Cerberus: the huge, three headed dog) of the cavern that leads out. Payment will be required and it is not monetary! Feeding the foul beast its favorite meal might distract it long enough to get to and use the gate! There is also an artifact that can be found and acquired. Hopefully, the PCs won't be conned by the various 'tour guides', who offer to help them leave!

Beyond the Black Door is an adventure for levels 9-12, being easily adjustable by changing the number of opponents in each melee encounter. Do you have a dungeon where a gate has not been detailed? Do you want your PCs to face shadows, ghouls, ghasts, vampires, babaus and vrocks? Do you want see them completely oblivious to plot twists and double-dealing, making them a 'mark' for a con? This one is for you!

A sacred spire in the Kingdom of Elleron is taken by the demon lord, Varnaku, and his minions. So begins the quest in Hanan Pacha to rid the demi-plane of the evil ones who seek to make it part of their domain! The Spire of the Raven God; The Lair of the Demon Princess, The Dead of Winter and the Labyrinth of the Lost, Beyond the Black Door and Wyrmslayer are adventures that take your PCs throughout the regions of the central lands of the Inland Sea. There are plenty of conflicts, political intrigue, memorable NPCs and mysteries to solve as the heros seek the ultimate threat to the Land of Hanan Pacha!

Visit the plane of Acheron, where a white dwarf sun provides eternal twilight and a blue giant sun only partially rises. Rent some vacation property along the river called Styx and witness cultists being baptized in its black waters. Meet a vampire called Vlad and his nosferatu pet. Most important of all, find your way out of this nightmare world before you get put on a slab in the mortuary, waiting to be rented out as a ghoul...

110394.name: Ghostriders Recon 3.5
110394.description:
From publisher blurb:

This publication has a fully detailed, Ghostriders (3.5) Recon squad, representing a platoon of the human kingdom of Mantheron. We have multi-class NPCs and single classes of several types in a set chain of command. The leaders have brief histories included with their stats. These NPCs can be used as pre-rolled characters as well as NPCs with CR ratings of 5-12. Also included is a medium war horse for cavalry detachments.

110395.name: Lair of the Demon Princess
110395.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lair of the Demon Princess. Some of the fiends who suffered defeat at the Stairway of the Gods have escaped to the jungles of Megiddo and are stirring up trouble in the kingdom of Kameroone.The heroes who take on this adventure gate into a cavern high in the Grand Caldera mountains. They travel down the gorge called, Giant Crag Pass, then seek out a minotaur who captains a ship that sails out of San Markos. The heroes battle their way to this village, facing a midnight raid by vrocks and gargoyles, on the high seas, into the jungle of Megiddo and finally into the Lair of the Demon Princess!

The adventure features a variety of locales, several new monsters, traveling encounters and a dungeon crawl that leads to the final confrontation. This adventure is crafted for levels 8-12 and can fit in most any campaign. It's easily modified for lower or higher level groups. Note: previews do not match new page background.

110396.name: The Dead of Winter (at Bearhamer Hall)
110396.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Caldera Mountains are a dangerous place at any time of the year, but especially during the Dead of Winter at Bearhammer Hall.
Rumor has it that the ancient gods, called 'Titans', sleep in these lands. Their offspring, the true giants, prowl these high places guarding the treasure left behind by their creators. An undead ettin (Wokrah), commands undead goblins who are terrorizing the forest plateau. Wokrah's master, a mysterious, evil wizard is trying to acquire an undead army.
This is a medium length adventure that is the third in a series that introduces adventurers to the world of Hanan Pacha. The first two, Spire of the Raven God and Lair of the Demon Princess both describe the evil that's menacing the demi-plane world. This one continues that theme and reveals a second location that connects to the dreaded, Labyrinth of the Lost (the 4th adventure). All four link together in events noted through the storyline. This one can be completed in one or two playing sessions.
The adventure is also easy to place in most fantasy settings. It is most suited to levels 7 - 12 characters that are strong on abilities, weaponry and magic. Death comes easily and critical mistakes can cost characters their lives!

110397.name: The Inn of Limbus
110397.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Damsel in Distress!

A young mother of royal blood has been kidnapped from the village of Buckshire, in the Kingdom of Elleron! In this age of chivalry, the quest to save a young woman from evil demons is the highest honor, the highest responsiblity a hero can ask for!

Follow the trail of her abductors through the forest, into the outlands between planes and to the Inn of Limbus. The inn serves as a portal to the lower planes, it is also ruled by a mysterious deity called The Neutrality. The inn is also a place of sanctuary where all races of beings are safe from others, unless the Neutrality of Limbus is violated!

Investigate and find the clues to where she has been taken and why. Explore the dungeon and sewers below the inn, where anything goes and danger lurks around every dark, dank corner. Levels 8-12 of a variety of classes are best suited for this 56 page adventure. The NPC and monster appendix adds twenty more pages at the end.

110398.name: The Labyrinth of the Lost
110398.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Labyrinth of the Lost!

Just like most of our other modules, this adventure features multiple hooks to draw your PCs into the story. There is travel across the different ecosystems of this interesting demi-plane. One might meet friends or foes anywhere in the adventure. There is political intrigue and real personalities clashing to add spice to the detailed locations. People live and die here, your PCs are just the ones who might be able to help rid the land of evil!

The world of Hanan Pacha faces a mortal threat: evil wizards are trying to open the Black Door to the undead realms. With this gate open, the titan, Erebus, awakens from his ages-long slumber. He is angry because undead are being summoned by this foul gate. Mortals only have a limited time to deal with this threat before Erebus calls forth the other titans, who will wreak havoc on the mortals for their insolence! Characters of Levels 8 to 12, who have magic and magical weapons are best suited for this advenutre. A second file provided for your convenience has all of the dungeon maps.

110399.name: Welcome to My Nightmare
110399.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to my Nightmare is for any medevial fantasy world. A variety character classes of levels 3 - 7 are best suited for this mini-adventure.

The heroes are traveling a dusty country road and happen upon a village named Newburough. This tiny village has a big problem brewing in the town graveyard. The hilltop boneyard is shrouded in mists during the night and strange figures are seen walking on the edge of sight. Residents are afraid to venture into it and those who have are not seen again! Challenge your players to tackle this threat before the town and its residents are overwhelmed by undead!

When you are taking a journey on a highway, you sometimes need a change of scenery: you need to take an exit and get off that road for awhile. Our new Exit 295 series gives a DM the opportunity to jump-start a lackluster playing session. Insert this into your campaign wherever and whenever you need a break from your regular campaign. Playing time varies from 1 to 2 hours.

110400.name: The Ghost of the Crypt
110400.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient graveyard and crypt, where heroes of the First Age are buried, has been taken over by foul undead. The crypt covers the famed Sword Dungeon that hides a treasure of magical weapons. Those weapons need to be in the hands of brave souls to wield them again for the forces of good. Those who have much courage, might and magic have a chance to survive!

This dungeon features a single, uniform map for each crypt entrance, each of which leads to a multi-room crypt, then a two level dungeon that needs cleared of evil. This is a stand alone adventure rated for levels 7-9, easily adjustable for higher or lower levels of PCs.This adventure fits well in any campaign world that has magic and magical weapons available. The text block style (of monster stats) is easily convertible to other versions and systems.

110401.name: Raiders of Los Arch
110401.description:
From Introduction:

"Raiders of Los Arch" is a Dungeons & Dragons adventure for five characters of 1st level. The adventure can be set in any backdrop or setting in a town near an old wood. This adventure is designed to work well with beginning players and characters. Things are kept relatively simple so it is easier to focus on the rules rather than on complex portions of the adventure.

110402.name: The Key of Fey
110402.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not everyone needs a hero and not every quest saves the village. When darkness engulfs light, mercenaries heed the call and perform the deeds no one else has the stomach for. An introductory adventure for 4-6 1st-level characters of all alignments, The Key of the Fey sets out a new style of adventure for 4e: mercenary adventures. Hired by an orc "merchant" to steal a portal key from innocent cultists, nothing is what it seems.

Recommended for mature players, this adventure provides unique subplots and PC interaction never allowed in most adventures. Switch employers midway through or manipulate everyone to double the payday. Engage in honorable combat or stab 'em in the back. Receive minor quest rewards for keeping secrets or make a name for yourself and earn extra gold. Remember that it’s not about who wins or loses, it’s about getting paid. Do you have what it takes?

The Key of the Fey includes...

A complete, full-length adventure with 20+ encounters, including skill challenges, to raise PCs from 1st to 3rd level (or higher);
Complete stats for all NPCs and monsters in every encounter, including new creatures built to challenge your PCs, plus new magic items and a new ritual that can change your characters forever;
Multiple options for a variety of storylines and NPC interactions - you can hack-and-slash your way through, break into negotiations, or use Stealth checks to sneak past the guards;
A behind-the-scenes review at the end of every chapter provides GMs with insight in NPC motivations to keep you one step ahead of your players;
Player handouts, including Character Introduction cards to cut straight to the chase and start playing;
Detailed, full-color maps for each encounter;
The interactive Gem of True Seeing layer with bonus content, printer setup, and other goodies unavailable in any print copy
Two endings: one good, one bad.

110403.name: Sudoku Recycled
110403.description:
Take a completed Sudoku and what can you do with it...how about getting a little more use before tossing it into the recycle bin...Sudoku Recycled are a series of pencil and paper games that you can play using a completed Sudoku. Currently, there are 3 different games you can play and all you need is a pencil, a completed Sudoku and the rules to the game you want to play.

There is:

Tic-Tac-Sudoku a simple Tic-Tac-Toe game for 2 players that brings Tic-Tac-Toe to a new level.

Snakedoku a 2-4 player game where you try and make snakes (the longer the better), but your opponents will try and stop you by cutting in front of you with their own snake. This game also has the Mongoose variant and everyone knows snakes don’t like mongooses.

Sudoku Warriors a 2-3 player game where you place you warriors around villages to gain control of their resources. When a battle breaks out you will need the village's resources to win the battle for a Province. Win the required number of Provinces and win the game.

Don't have a completed Sudoku to play on...no problem just make a Pseudoku.

110404.name: Aerie
110404.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Atop the peak of Mt. Auroch, the fabled griffon riders make their home in the city of Aerie. Epic in its scope, Aerie has been carved into the very face of the mountain itself. Its people rule over a vast swath of territory, its trade with the dwarves of Westerdeep and the city-states of the east is rich, and its fame has spread far and wide. Indeed, its fortunes have never seemed fairer.

But all is not well in the city of Aerie. Merchant and knight have turned one upon the other, and mercenaries play each off against the other. If the coming crisis cannot be averted, even a city of stone may burn.

Here you will find all the wonders of Aerie, from the cyclopean maze of the Giant's Steps to the glorious sunken mansions of the upper city. Breathe deep the fresh, crisp mountain air and gaze upon the magnificent waterfalls of the eastern wall. Learn what it is to soar through the clouds on the backs of griffons...

110405.name: Toyota Celica GT Rally
110405.description:
User Summary

In this most realistic rally simulation you get to drive Toyota's World Championship-winning car. Experience the thrill of speeding through darkness, rain, snow or sandstorm in 30 breathtaking stages. Becoming a world champion requires not only driving skill of the highest caliber, but also lightning fast reactions and excellent hand-eye coordination.

110406.name: Queen of Lies (OGL 3.0)
110406.description:
From the Introduction

Queen of Lies is a d20-compatible fantasy adventure for 11th-level player characters (PCs), and requires the use of the Dungeons and Dragons 3rd Edition Player's Handbook, published by Wizard's of the Coast. Included with this adventure are several pages of maps; magic items; and a new monster, the arachnemass.

From the Back of the Book

Deep below the surface, in the sunless lands of the Netherdeep, creatures of darkness build weapons and armies and dream about invasion. An attack on a temple sends the heroes on a quest to retrieve stolen artifacts and kidnapped friends. All signs point to the actions of the dark elves of Ul-Drakkan. But, even within that ancient fortress, there exists a deeper darkness....
Underground enemies lurk beyond every twisting passage, and strange creatures abound. The foul culture of the dark elves is both decadent and cruel, and the heroes may discover that they've stumbled into a web of deceit and treachery that threatens the lives of all who oppose the dark elf Queen. Can the heroes complete their mission without being discovered, or have their very actions been orchestrated by the Queen of Lies?

An epic fantasy adventure for 11th-level characters.

Queen of Lies is an action-packed adventure written by DMG author Monte Cook. A challenging scenario designed for 11th-level characters, Queen of Lies is filled with well-developed dark elf personalities and showcases their alien culture, full of merciless betrayal and dark lust.

Featuring new monsters and magic items that dwell within the unique environment, Queen of Lies will test the mettle of the hardiest of heroes.

User Comments

Queen of Lies was published before the setting Ptolus was published. After D&D 3.5 was released Queen of Lies (OGL 3.5) was revised for that version of D&D as well as adding it into the Ptolus setting.

110407.description:
In the distant world of Laar, wandering armies led by powerful magicians live a life of battle. For eons they fought for survival in this world, once scorched by fires of the Cataclysm. Now you have the chance to gather your own army and become the maker of your own fate. Perhaps your path will shape the fate of Laar as well...

In fierce battles in Berserk: Tactical Card Game - War of Realms, your life and the lives of your trusted armies will depend on your skill as a strategist and a warlord. And then, when in the heat of battle you forget about your wounds, forget about the future and about the past, you will understand why this is not simply a game. It is Berserk.

Berserk: Tactical Card Game was previously published in Russian as a collectible card game sold in randomized packs. This English edition of the game uses a fixed card format in which the same cards will be available in each standalone game and expansion pack. Two different ready-to-play decks are included in War of Realms, the first release in this new format.

Reimplements:

Berserk: Trading Card Game
110407.name: Berserk: Tactical Card Game – War of Realms

110408.name: The Guild Companion (Feb 2005)
110408.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110409.name: The Guild Companion (Mar 2005)
110409.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110410.name: Haunted Temples
110410.description:
From the publisher:
Foldout battle maps for your D&D campaign.

Dungeon Masters need awesome maps to create memorable encounters. This pack contains 3 full-color, double-sided, 21” x 30” battle maps with 1-inch scale grids. One map features two exciting, never-before-seen encounter locations: a crumbling cathedral and a haunted chapel with adjoining cemetery. All three maps provide attractive, reusable terrain suitable for any D&D campaign.

Map Pack products are compatible with all editions of the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game and are designed for use with D&D miniatures.

110411.name: Player's Option: Heroes of the Elemental Chaos

rpgissuearticle.88159: Bazaar of the Bizarre: Treasures of the Elemental Chaos

110411.description:
From the back of the book:
Command the Elements

Imagine untamed oceans wracked by lightning, whirlwinds of seething flame and roaring thunder, and massive shards of flying earth and ice. Welcome to the Elemental Chaos, the raw plane from which the gods and the primordials fashioned the world. The plane forms the foundation of the D&D cosmos and is home to countless elemental beings, including genies, archons, and demons. It's also a source of tremendous arcane power, the place where all fireballs and lightning bolts are born.

Now you can play a hero who harnesses the raw power of the Elemental Chaos. Player's Option: Heroes of the Elemental Chaos presents the elementalist sorcerer and the sha'ir wizard as new class options, as well as new character themes, feats, powers, paragon paths, epic destinies, and elemental companions.

110412.name: Cathedral of Chaos
110412.description:
From the publisher:
Illustrated cardstock terrain tiles for use with the Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game.

This roleplaying game accessory gives Dungeon Masters an easy and inexpensive way to include great-looking terrain in their games. This set provides ready-to-use, configurable tiles with which to build exciting encounter locations.

This set of dungeon tiles is unusual in that it includes 4 sheets of dungeon terrain tiles and 2 sheets of tokens to represent spell effects, magical traps, and elemental hazards.

110424.name: Who Let The Dogs Out
110424.description:
Who Let The Dogs Out (TM) is a new board game for all the family. The objective is to round up your four escaped dogs and get them back in your house with a bone for each. Remember - my doggie won't stay in if he don't have no bone.

The square game board is divided diagonally into four backyards, with a small house located in the middle of each edge of the board. The game commences with one of each players dogs placed on a marked starting position in each players backyard. Players then use game cards to move one or more dogs directly or to pick up sausages and/or bones to move their own dogs strategically towards, and eventually into, their own home. The first player to get all of their dogs into their house with a bone wins.

110425.name: Liong:   The Lost Amulets
110425.description:
User Summary

This game combines a hidden object I spy game and a mahjong matching game with a variety of mini-games chosen by chance from an upright spinning wheel. The player succeeds in these games to advance to the next level.

110426.name: Distress Signal
110426.description:
User Summary

A traitor aboard your space vessel forces you to crash land. You must explore the planet, and find other survivors of your crew. Use your bombs carefully, find a shield, and don't let the enemy creatures kill you.

110427.name: Don't Eat Me
110427.description:
User Summary

An overweight cannibal is trying to make you his into his dinner. You must throw various objects at him to push him away from you, and eventually down the cliff. To do so a letter will appear, if you hit that letter on the keyboard, an object will be thrown. But don't dawdle, the cannibal is getting closer!

110428.name: Double Edge
110428.description:
User Summary

A one or two player co-op beat em up game. You must defeat all the enemies on the screen to advance to the next level. After each level you can increase your power in one of a number of areas. Each level will feature more enemies, and they will be more dangerous.

110431.name: The Chaos Commandment
110431.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A conspiracy at the highest levels of the Calixian Church has finally come to fruition, and the sector rests on the edge of interstellar upheaval. Can you and your fellow Acolytes prevent this coming apocalypse?

The Chaos Commandment is an exciting adventure for Dark Heresy! The final chapter in The Apostasy Gambit trilogy (and also playable as a standalone adventure), this epic story pits a small band of Acolytes against an ancient and powerful threat. Throughout The Apostasy Gambit, Inquisitorial Acolytes have been combating the Maledictor’s Hand, an apocalyptic conspiracy deeply-rooted within the Imperial Church. The goal of this conspiracy is to throw down the ruling nobility and cleanse the Calixis Sector of these “sinners” by fomenting a holy war that will cleanse the debased black heart of the Sector with sacred fire. The Chaos Commandment concludes this trilogy, which began in Black Sepulchre and continued in The Church of the Damned, and the ending will be truly apocalyptic!

110433.name: imd-spelet
110433.description:
imd-spelet is an abstract game, but with a loose word description, or rather inspiration of todays internet usage.

The game-play is based on placing and moving tiles according to dice throws, the goal is to catch the opponent's tiles. It use four tiles as two sided dice with the values 0 or 1 to create binary numbers. The dice are thrown in a decided order to create a number between 0000 = 0 to 1111 = 15.

The game is published as the cover of an educational catalog connected to the IT, media and design (imd)-program at Södertörn University, Stockholm, Sweden.

110434.name: Farkle Frenzy
110434.description:
Farkle Frenzy adds an exciting new dimension to the classic Farkle dice game! As with traditional Farkle, players roll 6 dice, remove only the dice you want to use for points, then re-roll the remaining dice. Press down the funky Bubble Hub to vibrate and bounce the common die, and then let the fun begin! Take a risk and roll to collect scoring dice on the stepped Dice Risers, and race to fill yours first!
For 2 to 4 Players
Ages 8 & Up

110435.name: Lissy: Das große Pferdequiz
110435.description: Quiz game on the subject of horses, with puzzles and poster, questions from the categories horse and humans, riding and sport, horse mannerisms, horses’ bodies, knowledge and horse breeds. The arrow is turned for the category, correct answers earn a puzzle part, one can place a tip for answers on other player’s questions and earn irons which can be changed into puzzle parts. The first player to complete his puzzle wins the game.

videogame.119943: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Deluxe Edition

110436.name: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Operation Desert Storm Scenario Disk

videogamecompilation.119943: F-15 Strike Eagle II: Deluxe Edition

110436.description:
User Summary

This expansion disk adds eight historical missions based on Operation Desert Storm. Random missions can be generated for the Desert Storm theater, just like with the standard theaters. Certain Desert Storm missions replace the standard F-15 Strike Eagle II Maverick missiles with different air-to-ground ordnance, such as Paveway laser guided bombs, Rockeye II cluster bombs or HARM anti-radar missiles (as dictated by the target type).

Two additional theaters are added from Microprose's F-19 Stealth Fighter: North Cape and Central Europe. Night missions are now available in all theaters. Finally, the expansion disk includes the latest upgrade/bug fix patch for F-15SE2.

110437.description:
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.
110437.name: Die Kinder unserer Welt

110438.description:
"The world of stars" in English
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.
110438.name: Die Welt der Sterne

110439.description:
"The world of technology" in English
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.
110439.name: Die Welt der Technik

110440.name: Reporterspiel
110440.description: Players are journalists and travel round the world to collect interesting material and pictures for a new issue of GEOlino. One either moves the journalist and takes a round tile, takes a text tile or take an airline-ticket. 3 round or 3 white tiles on one subject result in a conference: A theme disk is laid out, all players bid on correct answers, for correct guesses players receive square pages for their issue. Complete magazines are scored for articles matching the title page, advertising and longest consecutive article on one subject, the player with the highest score wins the game.

110453.name: Koins
110453.description:
Koins is a simple and engaging game for three players.

The players all start out with a handful of coins. Each turn, the players bet one or more of their coins, the bets are called "hands".
If all hands are different, the middle hand is the winner (ex. 5 out of 2, 5, 7).
If two hands are the same, the third hand is the winner (ex. 2 out of 5, 5, 2).
If all hands are the same, there is no winner and the coins are put into the pool.

The player with the winning hand takes all the coins that were bet that turn, as well as the pool if there is any, and a new round is played.

110457.description: 32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions - if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.
110457.name: Die 7 Weltwunder Quiz-Spiel

110459.description:

In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his betting cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by betting one of his betting cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

110461.name: Matchet
110461.description: The game of MATCHET is played with 36 triangle shaped pieces. These pieces are tri-colored and have numbers from 1 to 10 at their points. The object of the game is to match the colors and numbers in multiples of 5, First person to get rid of all his triangles is the winner.

110471.name: Dreadnoughts (Avalon Hill)
110471.description:
Recreate all of the surface naval actions of WWII in the North Atlantic or command the German Navy and attempt to wrest control of the seas from the British Royal Navy.

By Thomas Dowell

110472.name: Computer Napoleonics
110472.description:
From Box / Manual

In this realistic computer simulation game, you can play Napoleon and direct his Army against England & Prussia.

By John Lyon & Joel Billings

110474.name: Das grosse Kosmos Natur-Quiz
110474.description: Two parts are combined into a complete photo. The first player to gather 12 parts that is 6 complete pictures, one from each category, wins the game. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves the butterfly: On a sunflower, trefoil or poppy spot a question must be answered by the active player, in some cases the other players can place a tip for the correct answer. The correct answer earns the active player a picture part or a trefoil, for a correct tip one receives a trefoil. Four trefoils can be exchanged for a picture part.

110475.name: Hand of Corruption
110475.description:
Publisher blurb:

A windswept Imperial penal world silently orbits its dimming sun, perilously close to the dark influence of Chaos. To claim such a prize for the Ruinous Powers would bring great favour and glory to you and your fellow Heretics, and its substantial resources would help lay the foundation for your own Black Crusade. But welcoming this world into the roiling bosom of the Screaming Vortex will be no easy task, and the planet holds its own dangerous secrets. Can you bring the corrupting gifts of Chaos to this forgotten world?

Fantasy Flight Games is excited to announce the upcoming release of Hand of Corruption, an adventure in three acts for Black Crusade! Presented in one comprehensive volume, Hand of Corruption is an epic story that takes you and your fellow Heretics from the swirling depths of the Screaming Vortex to the far reaches of the Calixis Sector, and then to a parched and windswept Imperial penal world called Saint Annard’s Penance. With a host of challenges designed to appeal to a range of group types and play styles, Hand of Corruption offers ample opportunities for both savvy roleplaying and gruelling combat.

110482.name: LEAP FROG: Bilingual Memory Mate
110482.description:
A memory game that teaches you French.

Memory Mate uses simple object matching to improve your child's concentration. Trying to remember where the pig, dog and chicken are hiding is a fun way to hone memory skills - all-important building blocks of learning!

A pair of puzzle cards match by picture and fit, one puzzle card as the English word and the other the word in Spanish.

Spread out all the cards facedown on a large flat surface. On your turn, flip over two cards to try to make a picture match.

If you match a pair, fit them side-by-side and say the name of the object shown in English and French. Keep the pair and try again for another match by turning over two new cards.

If the two cards picked don't match, your turn is over. Flip the cards facedown and try to remember where they are for next time.

Players alternate turns and continue to match until no cards remain. The winner is the player with the most pairs.

110483.name: Kuku
110483.description:
Kuku is a Polish traditional card game for two or more players. It's slightly modified version of Kemps.

It is played with standard deck of 52 cards. Each player is dealt a hand of 3 cards, but one player is dealt a hand of 4 cards. The rest of cards are irrelevant. If any player has three cards in the same color or value he says "kuku!" and wins. After dealing the player with 4 cards gives one of his cards to the player on his left. One card (not necessarily the same) is going around until one of the players has three cards in the same color or value.

110484.name: LEAP FROG Bingo
110484.description:
Six ways to play! Learn shapes, colors, animals, beginning letter sounds, counting and addition!

Object: Be the first player to shout "BINGO" by getting 4-in-a-row.

Game One: Color/Shape Match
Use the spinner, and cards with shapes on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the shape and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Blue Star!". Then all players search their cards for that color and shape. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match colors or just match shapes.

Game Two: Number Match
Use the spinner, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the number to which the arrow points. For example, "number 9!". Then all players search their cards for that number. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Game Three: Animal Match
Use the spinner, and cards with animals on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the animal and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Purple Lion!". Then all players search their cards for that color and animal. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match animals. Or for a beginning letter challenge, instead of announcing the animal the caller says "the animal that begins with M". Players then place Tad bingo chips on ALL animals on their cards that begin with M.

Game Four: Add-Up and Match
Use the spinner with the addition equations, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and solves the equation to which the arrow points and calls out the answer. For example, if the spinner points to 9+1, then the player solves it and calls out 10. Then all players search for 10 and cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Winning:
A player wins when they get 4 Tad bingo chips in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row and they shout out "bingo".

110485.name: The Guild Companion (Jan 2007)
110485.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

110488.name: Am Korallen-Riff
110488.description: On the board in four parts schools of fish and corals can be found in varying numbers and colours. Colour die, dot die und symbol die together result in a combination of three characteristics which players should find on the board. The board is variable and thus always new situations form. A player discovering the combination wanted shows it and marks it with a chip. If a combination has already been covered, the chip goes to the treasure chest. If an octopus is rolled, all chips from the board are put on the chest. If the chest is rolled the chips from the chest are distributed among the other players. The player placing his last chip wins the game.

110489.name: Benimm ist in
110489.description: The game comprises 110 cards with 220 situations taken from daily life. Each card describes the situation and suggests three different ways of behaviour, only one way is the correct one. Players roll the die and move their pawn, the end spot of the move determines what happens: On an empty spot they stop or buy another move with 3 Chips. On a "Benimm ist in" spot one draws a card and answers the question. A correct answer is rewarded with a chip. On the red "live"-spots one must enact the situation pictured on the board, the other players act as jury. Wrong answers send the player back 3 spots. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

110490.description: Players start at the castle door and try to reach the tower, they have to pass 29 spaces and overcome ghosts. Good dice rolls and clever use of the results will help a player to be there first and win. In his turn a player rolls all 3 dice: To enter a spot a dice in the roll must show the number of the space or it must be possible to form the number from the numbers rolled. When the dice have fallen accordingly, one can enter several spots in sequence. If helmet and armour are rolled at the same time, one can move to the next armour chip. All players not in first place may re-roll one die per turn.
110490.name: Das Geister-Spiel

110491.name: Das große Familien-Quiz
110491.description: 6.000 questions in three difficulties, the themes are technology, politics, sky & earth, history, nature, art and culture, sports and fun and general, players try to reach the golden finish spot as quickly as possible by answering questions in the colour-coded difficulty range their piece stands in. Correct answers allow movement, themes are determined by roll of the die.

110492.name: Das Gute-Nacht-Spiel
110492.description: The 36 Good Night tiles show 6 times activities necessary before going to bed. Each player tries to be the first to collect one motif each. In his turn he rolls the colour die and moves to the next spot in this colour, on a Sandman spot he can turn over a tile and take it if he has not got the motif yet. On the purple corner spots one has to give back the motif shown. Older children can play with the number die, then the "6" sends a player to the purple corner spot.

110493.name: Das Indianer-Spiel
110493.description: The game board shows an Indian camp in full swing, each player tries to find 8 tiles corresponding to his theme tile from a total of 48 tiles, colour coding makes it easier to spot fitting tiles. In his turn a player can turn up as many tiles as he wants - if "Überfall" is turned up the move ends and he receives no tiles. If he ends his move voluntarily he can keep all tiles corresponding to his theme. The first player who has found all 8 tiles can lay out all tiles on the board, ends the game and wins.

110494.name: Ost !
110494.description:
Ost ! is a medieval skirmish miniature wargame, originally published in Vae Victis magazine issue #32.

The game uses a simple chit-pull system (using common playing cards) to alternate minis activation between players. Each activated figure has 2 actions, which can be used to move, fight, fire, reload a weapon or perform a special action (such as climbing on horseback). Combat is resolved by an opposed d10 roll with modifiers (for fighters skill, armor, weapons...), ranged combat by a die roll on a table.

The game includes rules for ranged weapons, cover, armor, horse riding, morale, civilians and a scenario ("Les routiers sont sympas").

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds

110495.name: Alphabet Land
110495.description:
User Summary

Alphabet Land is a simple boardgame intended for young audiences (recommended ages 4-8). Players use a spinner to travel around the board collecting letters of the alphabet, which are associated with particular spaces. The spaces are shown as balloons. Landing on a space with a letter on it allows the player to collect that letter. Landing on a black balloon allows a player to take a letter from anywhere on the board. Landing on a purpler balloon allows the player to steal a letter from another player. A player is "stung" and must return a card to the board if he or she lands on a spot showing the Alpha-Bee.

The game ends when a player lands on the Finish spot with an exact spin. At that point all players count up there cards. The player with the most cards wins.

This title appears to take some inspiration from Candyland.

110496.name: The Inheritance: Panic in Las Vegas
110496.description:
User Summary:

A graphical adventure game from Infogrames, with a point-and-click interface and cartoony graphics.

From the back of the box:

The 1960'. New Haven. Connecticut.

In his sordid room, Peter, lying dejectedly on his bed, contemplated the wall with a mournful eye.
Debts were mounting up and there was no glimmer of hope on the horizon.
He hardly dared move outside his room for fear of meeting one of his many creditors. Things were looking desperate when there was a knock at the door.
"A letter for you", cried the caretaker's voice.
To his surprise he found an airline ticket to Las Vegas together with $200. A short note accompanied these welcome gifts.
"Your aunt has just died making you sole heir to her fortune. However, there is one condition, you have to repeat her achievement of the thirties to win a million dollars in one night in Las Vegas."
There wasn't a moment to lose if he wanted to avoid his creditors.
He got out of the building and a race across town ensued. And all for the sake of an eccentric old woman. "How can I shake off my pursuer", he mused.
So get to where the action is and set off now for the depraved city that's known as LAS VEGAS.

110497.name: Trading Team
110497.description:
From the front cover:

This folio adventure is designed for characters with Navy, Scout Service, Merchant, or other backgrounds in the service of a large merchant company in the Reaver's Deep sector.

The characters used in Trading Team are assigned to the Far Trader Scotian Huntress.

110498.name: Fleetwatch
110498.description:
From the front cover:

This folio adventure is designed for characters with Navy, Marine, or Scout Service backgrounds recalled to active duty during the Fifth Frontier War.

The characters used in FLEETWATCH are personnel assigned to the Close Escort Stag.
